intro: Barleria buxifolia var. mysorensis, commonly known as the Mysore barleria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with a leathery texture. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its compact growth habit and attractive foliage make it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
